com.gh.bmd.jrt.processor.builder

Interface WrapperRoutineBuilder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.gh.bmd.jrt.builder.ConfigurableBuilder, com.gh.bmd.jrt.builder.SharableBuilder

    public interface WrapperRoutineBuilder
extends com.gh.bmd.jrt.builder.SharableBuilder
    Interface defining a builder of routines wrapping an object instance.

    Note that only instance methods can be asynchronously invoked through the routines created by this builder.

    Created by davide on 3/7/15.

    See Also:
    Bind, Pass, ShareGroup, Timeout, TimeoutAction, Wrap

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <TYPE> TYPE buildWrapper(Class<TYPE> itf)
      Returns a wrapper object enabling asynchronous calling of the target instance methods.

      Returns a wrapper object enabling asynchronous calling of the target instance methods.
      WrapperRoutineBuilder withConfiguration(com.gh.bmd.jrt.builder.RoutineConfiguration configuration)
      Note that all the options related to the output and input channels will be ignored.
      WrapperRoutineBuilder withShareGroup(String group)

    • Method Detail

      • buildWrapper

        @Nonnull
<TYPE> TYPE buildWrapper(@Nonnull
                               Class<TYPE> itf)
        Returns a wrapper object enabling asynchronous calling of the target instance methods.

        The routines used for calling the methods will honor the attributes specified in any optional Bind, Timeout, TimeoutAction and Pass annotations.
        Note that such annotations will override any configuration set through the builder.

        The wrapping object is created through code generation based on the interfaces annotated with Wrap. The generated class will share the same package of the specified interface and will have a name of the type: JRoutine_<itf_simple_name>
        It is actually possible to avoid the use of reflection for the wrapper instantiation by explicitly calling the JRoutine_<itf_simple_name>.on() method. Note, however, that, since the class is generated, a generic IDE may highlight an error even if the compilation is successful.
        Note also that you'll need to enable annotation pre-processing by adding the processor artifact to the specific project dependencies.

        Type Parameters:
        TYPE - the interface type.
        Parameters:
        itf - the interface implemented by the return object.
        Returns:
        the wrapping object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified class does not represent an interface.
        NullPointerException - if the specified class is null.

      • buildWrapper

        @Nonnull
<TYPE> TYPE buildWrapper(@Nonnull
                               com.gh.bmd.jrt.common.ClassToken<TYPE> itf)
        Returns a wrapper object enabling asynchronous calling of the target instance methods.

        The routines used for calling the methods will honor the attributes specified in any optional Bind, Timeout, TimeoutAction and Pass annotations.
        Note that such annotations will override any configuration set through the builder.

        The wrapping object is created through code generation based on the interfaces annotated with Wrap. The generated class will share the same package of the specified interface and will have a name of the type: JRoutine_<itf_simple_name>
        It is actually possible to avoid the use of reflection for the wrapper instantiation by explicitly calling the JRoutine_<itf_simple_name>.on() method. Note, however, that, since the class is generated, a generic IDE may highlight an error even if the compilation is successful.
        Note also that you'll need to enable annotation pre-processing by adding the processor artifact to the specific project dependencies.

        Type Parameters:
        TYPE - the interface type.
        Parameters:
        itf - the token of the interface implemented by the return object.
        Returns:
        the wrapping object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified class does not represent an interface.
        NullPointerException - if the specified class is null.
